title.narrative: Thematic Programme on Rule of Law and Human Rights

description.narrative: The thematic programme will support a fair and inclusive peace process and will be underpinned by critical support to meet the urgent need of enhancing the application of and respect for international human rights standards in Myanmar's justice system.

mailing-address.narrative: No. 3, Pyay Road, 6 Miles, Hlaing Township, Yangon, Myanmar

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: First disbursement is to be made.
One disbursement will be made in December 2019.

One Multi-stakeholder dialogue between SoMe companies, GoM, diplomatic community, CSOs and media stakeholders result in an outcome document for countering disinformation and hate speech. Media stakeholders and CSOs are capacitated to promote laws and practices that protect and enhance freedom of expression and benefit from legal protection.(For 2021-22)

Extend to which actors agree on outcome document and follows up. No. of closed-door multi-stakeholder dialogue meetings held. For 2021-22): Description of actions taken as a result of advocacy efforts

target.value: 1) At the end of year 1, a communication plan has been developed. 2) At the end of year 2, one multi-stakeholder dialogue meeting has been conducted. 3) At the end of year 2, an outcome document for countering disinformation and hate speech has been developed and distributed to relevant actors.

actual.value: A pre-meeting on 5 March with key stakeholders from Myanmar media was held before lock-down from which important points and recommendations on mis- and disinformation were raised from the media representatives. A dialogue meeting was held online on 30 June 2020 with digital rights groups and civil society organisations.

target.value: Description of actions taken as a result of advocacy efforts.
Description of actions taken as a result of advocacy efforts.

title.narrative:
A Myanmar organisation gets certified factchecker via Poynter’s Institute and operate efficiently.
Myanmar’s media actors are safeguarded and strengthened by sustainable safety and protection measures.(for 2021-22)

At least one certified third-party fact-checker in Myanmar established countering disinformation and hate speech on Facebook. For 2021-22; Male and female media workers (gender disaggregated) responded to by protection mechanisms, e.g., relocation to safe location, legal defence services. Safety guidelines are applied by journalists and media houses. Specific gender responsive measures taken that benefit women journalists.

target.value: 1) At the end of year 1, mapping and selection of feasible fact-checking organisations has been conducted. 2) At the end of year 2, at least one organisation has been certified as factchecker and has been monitoring content since 1 April 2020. 3) At the end of year 2, the implementing partner(s) has relevant safety procedures in place.

actual.value: At least one certified third-party fact-checker in Myanmar through Poynter’s Institute established to counter disinformation and hate speech on Facebook

target.value: Male and female media workers (gender disaggregated) responded to by protection mechanisms, e.g., relocation to safe location, legal defence services. Safety guidelines are applied by journalists and media houses. Specific gender responsive measures taken that benefit women journalists.

Male and female media workers (gender disaggregated) responded to by protection mechanisms, e.g., relocation to safe location, legal defence services. Safety guidelines are applied by journalists and media houses. Specific gender responsive measures taken that benefit women journalists.

title.narrative: Disinformation and hate speech are reduced, while reliable public-interest journalism reaches and engages audiences in the election cycle.

Number of stories incl. reach and engagement of stories produced during programme period related to election. Number of posts/accounts removed on Facebook. Extend to which stakeholders participate and follow up on action plan

target.value: 1) By the end of the project. at least one organisation has been certified as factchecker and has been monitoring content since 1 April 2020. 2) By the end of the project. a study documents patterns of disinformation and content is produced based on the findings from this study. 2a) By the end of the project. information on disformers will be shared with Facebook to allow demoting and/or closing accounts as well as production of journalistic stories on the topic. depending on solid documentation. 3) By the end of the project. two closed-door multi-stakeholder meetings have been held resulting in increased awareness among key stakeholders. An action plan is developed and follow up on by stakeholders. 4) Reliable and relevant content covering the election and disinformation has been published as a result of different efforts.

title.narrative:
Hate speech and disinformation content creators are identified and content demoted and/or accounts removed.
Targeted media increasingly sustainable and trustworthy, producing public interest media content reflecting the diversity of society, and countering disinformation. (for 2021-22)

Extend to which disinformation patterns are identified. Number of accounts/posts removed.
For 2021-22: Media supported by IMS-Fojo are able to sustain their audiences. Media supported by IMS-Fojo are able to do regular content production.

target.value: Media supported by IMS-Fojo are able to sustain their audiences Media supported by IMS-Fojo are able to do regular content production
Media supported by IMS-Fojo are able to sustain their audiences Media supported by IMS-Fojo are able to do regular content production

1) At the end of year 1, the media house/organisation where the identification model will be institutionalised is selected and the collaboration with Rappler is initiated. 2a) At the end of year 2, information on disinformers is shared with Facebook to allow demoting of content and/or closing of accounts, depending on solid documentation. 2b) At the end of year 2, media house has produced and distributed journalistic stories under the topic of disinformation and coordinated inauthentic behaviour depending on solid documentation. 3) At the end of year 2, the implementing partner(s) has relevant safety procedures in place. 4) At the end of year 2, two meetings on verification tools have been conducted with participation of selected media houses.

actual.value: One organization has been selected and collaboration with Rappler has been initiated. Information on disinformers habe been shared with Facebook to allow demoting of content and closing accounts. Two media houses produced and distributed journalistic stories regarding disinformation. The selected organization has been using advanced verification tools.

title.narrative: Targeted media provide reliable and relevant election coverage reaching and engaging its audience in the election.
1) No. of stories covering the election produced and distributed by selected media. 2) Level of reach of produced content.

target.value: 1) At the end of year 2, the selected media will have produced and distributed weekly election coverage over a period of 6 months. 2) At the end of year 2, the selected media have distributed election coverage nationwide measured trough engagement on Facebook and no. of audiences. 3) At the end of year 2, the implementing partners have relevant safety procedures in place.

actual.value: The two media partners produced programs and segments that debunked mis- and disinformation content which helped to educate audiences on media literacy. They produced similar TV programs debunking false information focusing on the COVID-19 pandemic and General Election which were published online and on TV. Misinformation Busters team produced 33 episodes over the course of the project consisting of 116 segments in 2020, with the top segment having over 500.000 views.
